page_analysis.text_content:
Grade

Fig 45 Height limits for structures on slopes greater than 10%

When measuring    Use    Which is defined as    Illus.

The height of a structure on land with natural slope ≤ 10%    Existing Grade    for each building or structure, the lowest point of adjacent ground elevation prior to grading or fill    Fig 44 on this page

The height of a structure on land with natural slope > 10%    Grade    adjacent ground elevation of the finished or existing grade, whichever is lower--at any point of the structure    Fig 45 on this page

A daylight plane    Average grade    average of the grade at the midpoint of the building and the grade at the closest point on the abutting site    Figs 20-21 pp. 26-27

Fig 44 Existing vs. Finished grade

[Diagram shows a two-story house with basement, indicating height measurement from lowest point of ground elevation before fill (existing grade) to top of structure, with finished grade (after fill) and existing grade (before fill) labeled]

lowest point of ground elevation before fill (existing grade) adjacent to the structure

30' above existing grade
30' above finished grade

The structure must comply with the lower of the two limits at all points along the slope

Height
Height

Existing grade (before fill)

Fig 46 Comparison of different grades

[Diagram shows angular lines representing different slope percentages: 10%, 20%, 30%, 40%, 50%]

47

visual_elements.description: A four-column table defining grade measurements with columns for 'When measuring', 'Use', 'Which is defined as', and 'Illus.' Contains three rows defining different grade measurement scenarios

Fig 44 - Cross-section diagram of a two-story house with basement showing existing vs. finished grade, with labels for height measurement points, finished grade after fill, existing grade before fill, and lowest point of ground elevation

Fig 45 - Diagram showing height limits for structures on slopes greater than 10%, depicting buildings on a slope with 30' height limits measured from both existing and finished grade, with note about compliance with lower limits
visual_elements.location: top right and center right of page

visual_elements.description: Fig 46 - Angular diagram showing comparison of different slope grades at 10%, 20%, 30%, 40%, and 50% angles

technical_specifications.parameter: Natural slope threshold for grade measurement method
Slope percentages shown in comparison diagram

additional_notes: Page number 47 appears at bottom right
Image quality is clear and legible throughout

qualifiers.text: When measuring the height of a structure on land with natural slope ≤ 10%
When measuring the height of a structure on land with natural slope > 10%
for structures on slopes greater than 10%

conditions.text: The structure must comply with the lower of the two limits at all points along the slope

logical_relationships.expression: If natural slope ≤ 10%, then use Existing Grade
If natural slope > 10%, then use Grade (whichever is lower--finished or existing grade at any point of the structure)
For slopes > 10%, structure must comply with lower of 30' above existing grade AND 30' above finished grade

execution_sequence.action: Determine the natural slope percentage of the land
Select appropriate grade measurement method based on slope
Apply height limits and compliance requirements
